author: Subhajit Ganguly

resources.name: Aircraft Movements: In Aircraft Movements, landing and take-off of an aircraft are counted separately i.e., one landing and one take-off are counted as two movements. Passengers: A passenger is a person occupying separate seat on a one-way trip. An infant-in arm is not considered a passenger for statistical purposes. Freight: Freight consists of emplaned or actually air lifted (and not Freight accepted by the carrier) goods, newspapers, diplomatic bags, parcel post and express parcel carried by aircraft on commercial flights (scheduled and non-scheduled). Passenger’s regular or excess baggage and trucked freight are excluded from Freight. Aircraft Movements and Passenger in number (NOS), Freight in metric tones (MT).

organization.description:
India specific data
For visualizations, please visit: http://in.okfn.org/visualized-data/
organization.title: India Data
organization.name: india

Freight: Freight consists of emplaned or actually air lifted (and not Freight accepted by the carrier) goods, newspapers, diplomatic bags, parcel post and express parcel carried by aircraft on commercial flights (scheduled and non-scheduled). Passenger’s regular or excess baggage and trucked freight are excluded from Freight. Aircraft Movements and Passenger in number (NOS), Freight in metric tones (MT).
title: Annual Air Traffic Handled at All Indian Airports
